reviews.review_msg: Tests were very heavy and unrealistic. He rarely answers emails.
Terrible class. Lecture slides are full of mistakes and are only posted after the lecture. Lots of readings. Concepts are interesting. Only take it if you are willing to take a bad grade.

Overall a good teacher, and a pretty enjoyable class. The exams are just like the practice exams he provides, if you can do those, you can do the real exam. Sent out an assignment due the day of final only a week before the test which was kinda weird but it only took 10 mins and was actually kinda helpful for understanding the exam. Good class.

Over all not that bad but, has bad habit of standing in front of the overhead so no one can see what he is writing. And then when he finishes writing he shuts it off right away before you can copy it. Ideas and train of thought very scattered; makes simple concepts confusing. Notes in word pdfs.

Easy class, high averages. Practice tests similar to actual tests. He's really interested in the topic and it is quite interesting anyways. Likes seeing students engaged and is very helpful. Does send notes several times and presentations using word/overhead which is a little odd.

Easy course, extremely high class avgs.  Lectures seem complicated but if u read the notes u see its not. Really cool material. Textbook not required. Only complaint is that Breden sends out notes, then resends them (sometimes multiple times) b/c of typos/errors/etc. Not a big deal but an annoyance.
